title: Ticket #2994: Have condor_defrag detect starvation
description:
condor_defrag can effectively defragment the cluster, but it acts without regards to whether the cluster needs to be defragmented.

What techniques are available to determine if there are any starved jobs out there?

At a minimum, it seems like we should be able query the request_* attributes in the schedd and calculate whether it is possible for a job to starve. If it's not possible, we probably don't need to initialize draining.

While I like the idea of p-slots, any user that puts in for a high-memory job on a busy cluster (read: all clusters that I know about), their job just seems to starve.
